title: Introduction to NanoEngineering
description: Understanding nanotechnology, broad implications; miniaturization: scaling laws; nanoscale physics; types and properties of nanomaterials; nanomechanical oscillators, nano(bio)electronics, nanoscale heat transfer; fluids at nanoscale; machinery cell; applications of nanobiotechnology and nanobiotechnology. Cross-listed with NANO 201. Students may not receive credit for both CENG 211 and NANO 201. Prerequisites: graduate standing.
